instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_AXG: What is PPVCORE_S0_AXG? This is vcore going to the CPUâ€™s integrated graphics processor for CPUs that have an integrated GPU. When this is missing on a device that has an integrated GPU and no discrete GPU, it usually means either no screen is detected, or the GPU integrated into the CPU is dead..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3 beep
threads.message:
hey guys checked balls under memory slot nothing seem loose.

voltages:

everything is good with the exception of <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_AXG</SIGNAL> 0v 0.004 res
under thermal pch is heating up like a mofo.

i dont know history doesnt seem to have any liquid?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3 beep
threads.message:
Usually no AXG voltage under low graphics charge.
CPU CORE and AXG have very low ohm value to ground as normal on this board.
Did you test one (known good) RAM module at a time, each slot by separate?
Do you have DDR3 test card?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3 beep
threads.message: yeh i test each slot with one ram seated same issue. i cant seem to locate ddr3 test card atm.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3 beep
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3 beep
threads.message:
try with the top slot only, usually the slot closer to the keyboard is the culprit.
the correct memory for this logic board is PC3-10600S.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3 beep
threads.message:
ok i slapped it in... pressed button.

how does this even work?

must i power the board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3 beep
threads.message:
Do NOT power up the board.
All LEDs must lit.
Some of them (8 I suppose) will be at max.
If one LED stays off, corresponding line is broken (to CPU); or bad contact on the socket.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3 beep
threads.message: nvm. issue gone. ultrasonic the machine its all good. touched up first line of balls. i only seen the first couple go bad... not sure what else also someone tightened the screws real hard loosened them a bit.
